Leaves: Blades 30 cm long, smooth, hairless or with sparse covering of soft hairs, flat or somewhat in-rolled. With small flap over where joins with stem.
Flowers: Contracted head up to 25 cm long. With many spikelets surrounded by bracts up to 1.5 cm long, which are straw coloured or translucent.
FruitSeeds: Sharp pointed 6-9 mm long pale brown to purple with wart-like growths. With twice-bent awns 3.5-6 cm long.
DistinguishingFeatures: Difficult to distinguish from other exotic Needlegrasses (*Nassella* species) but can be distinguished from native spear grasses (*Austrostipa* and *Poa* species) by crown-like structure below seed awns.
